verses.verse: In you, O LORD, I have taken refuge; let me never be put to shame.
In your righteousness rescue me and deliver me; hear my plea and save me.
Be to me a rock of refuge to which I can always go; proclaim the order to save me, for you are my rock and my fortress.
O my God, rescue me from the hands of the impious, from the grasp of cruel and ruthless foes.
You, O LORD, are my hope, my confidence, O God, from my youth.
I have relied upon you since birth, and you have been my strength from my mother’s womb; my praise rises unceasingly to you.[b]
I have become a portent to many,[c] but you are my sure refuge.
My mouth is filled with your praises as I relate your glory all day long.
Do not cast me off in my old age; do not forsake me when my strength is completely spent.
For my enemies speak against me, and those who seek my life plot together.
They say: “God has abandoned him; go after him and seize him, for no one will come to his rescue.”
O God, do not remain aloof from me; come quickly to help me, O my God.
Let those who accuse me be put to shame and perish; let those who are determined to harm me incur contempt and disgrace.[d]
But I will hope in you continually and will render even more praise to you.
[e]My lips will proclaim your righteous deeds and your salvation all day long, though I do not know their extent.[f]
I will speak of your mighty deeds, O Lord GOD, and declare your righteousness,[g] yours alone.
O God, you have taught me from my youth, and to this day I proclaim your marvelous works.
Now that I am old and my hair is gray,[h] do not abandon me, O God, until I have extolled your might to all the generations yet to come, your strength
and your righteousness, O God, to the highest heavens. You have done great things; O God, who is there who is like you?
You have shown me many afflictions and hardships, but you will once again revive me. From the depths of the earth[i] you will once again raise me up.
You will restore my honor and console me once again.
Then I will also praise[j] you with the harp for your faithfulness, O my God. I will sing praises to you with the lyre, O Holy One of Israel.
When I sing to you, my lips will rejoice, and so will my soul, which you have redeemed.
All day long my tongue will relate your righteousness. For those who intended to do me harm will suffer shame and disgrace.
